sections.purpose: To provide immediate decontamination of the body in case of chemical splashes or fires.
sections.scope: Applicable to emergency safety in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Position the affected person directly under the shower head.
Pull the activation handle or chain firmly to start the water flow.
Remove contaminated clothing and shoes while the water is running.
Remain under the shower for at least 15 minutes to flush all chemicals.
Seek medical attention immediately after the decontamination process.
The shower should be tested monthly to ensure proper operation.
Keep the area under the shower clear of any obstructions at all times.
precautions: Do not use the safety shower for non-emergency purposes like cleaning equipment.
Ensure the floor area has proper drainage to prevent flooding.
Inform lab personnel and supervisors immediately when the shower is activated.
Replace any privacy curtains or towels kept in the vicinity after use.
Maintain clear signage for the location of the shower.
